results.title: Mind's eye
results.creator_credit: Brandon Tomlin and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: For years, I have been compiling images in my mind’s eye, while passing through the laneways of Richmond, to the neon lights of Melbourne. Despite having cerebral palsy, Brandon Tomlin lives independently and spends his time taking photos of Melbourne and surrounding suburbs. This is a compilation of some of his work.

results.title: My best mate
results.creator_credit: Aaron Austin and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Huss was polite, generous and non-judgemental. Big Issue vendor, Aaron Austin paints a portrait of a man from the war-torn country of Somalia who, despite his violent upbringing, was kind to everyone who crossed his path. A soccer fan and storyteller, Huss was taken from Aaron when he was stabbed in the doorway of his flat in 2007.

results.title: Australia : the Land of my dreams = Kraj moich marzen
results.creator_credit: Mariola Gorna and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Born in Poland, Mariola chose to come to Australia. After a long wait in Greece, she was finally granted the right to immigrate to Australia. She tells of the second family she found at Brintons carpet factory and how they were there for her during some of her most difficult times.

results.title: The Loom never stops : a conversation with Thomas Ladgrove
results.creator_credit: Thomas Ladgrove and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: When Thomas Ladgrove started work at Brintons carpet factory in 1967, he was a ward of the state. He eventually started working with the loom and became the youngest weaver in Australia and England at age 18. He describes his work on the loom as well as staff morale when it became clear that Brintons was suffering, the subsequent rumours and worry and then the closure when the announcement to cease operations was made.

results.title: Long term employment
results.creator_credit: Michael Farquhar and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Michael Farquhar walked into Brintons to leave his details at reception. The same day he had and interview and got a job. In his time there, he moved through many different areas and went through many life changes, from renting an appartment to marriage, owning a home and raising a family. When Brintons closed in 2008, Michael had worked there for 21 years. He talks about what it was like to work there, in the good and bad times.

results.title: Why did you leave such a beautiful place?
results.creator_credit: Margaret O'Connell and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Margaret O’Connell tells of how she moved to be with her sister in Geelong, of her first days at Brintons carpet factory and how her loneliness was soon replaced by the family she made there. She join the Equal Opportunity and Consultative Committees and, when the factory closed in 2008, had been there for 32 years.

results.title: The Journey begins at midnight
results.creator_credit: Joseph Jovic and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Josip tells of his upbringing on a farm in Coatia and how the lure of a better life brought him to Australia, Geelong and, eventually, to Brintons Carpets. Learning English within a few years, Josip soon became a shop steward and a representative on the Consultative Committee and he tells of the closure of Brintons and how it led to his retirement.

results.title: Geelong TCUFA : weaving and winding : more than a job : Digital Storytelling project
results.brief_description: Five employees of carpet manufacturer Brintons and Textile Clothing and Footwear Union tell about their lives before, during and after working at Brintons. The factory closed in June 2008, leaving 100 people without jobs.

results.title: In flux
results.creator_credit: Ryan Linfors, Legacy and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: When Ryan joined Legacy, he was six years old and fatherless. Legacy taught him about acceptance and gave him three close friends. He tells of his relationship with Bec, Bear and Brad and how they have been there for him and have recently helped him in his decision to become a Legacy leader.

results.title: Family
results.creator_credit: Rebecca Cherry, Legacy and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Rebecca has been involved in various capacities in Legacy since her father died when she was seven. Rebecca talks about the different families in her life, especially the one she has found at Legacy. She has gone from being a Rotary Exchange student to a Legacy leader.
